overview: From 2026-01-27 to 2026-01-28, elizaos/eliza had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 5 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [Research] Poke App Analysis - All Team Members
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Every team member must try Poke app and document the experience. This is our form factor model.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Complete Poke onboarding
- [ ] Test iMessage and Telegram flows
- [ ] Note: You can negotiate price down to $0/month (talk the bouncer down)
- [ ] Document the exact onboarding flow
- [ ] Screenshot key interactions
- [ ] Share findings in Discord #cloud channel

## Technical Notes

* Poke has unique "talk down the bouncer" pricing negotiation
* Focus on their no-app onboarding magic
* This is the form factor we're copying
* URL: poke app (search "poke app")

## Assignees

All team members

## Priority

**P0 - Day 1**

topIssues.title: [Research] Claudebot Deep Dive - All Team Members
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Every team member must set up and use Claudebot extensively to understand the competition before building.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Each team member has Claudebot running (Mac Mini may be required)
- [ ] Test email, code, tasks, calendar functions
- [ ] Document strengths and weaknesses
- [ ] Screenshot key flows
- [ ] Share findings in Discord #cloud channel

## Technical Notes

* Focus on what makes it feel magical
* Identify features we can do better
* This is research, not optional - required before building

## Assignees

All team members

## Priority

**P0 - Day 1**

topIssues.title: [Research] Twilio SMS Regulatory Compliance
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Research Twilio SMS regulatory requirements and verify our existing account setup from the Trump project.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Verify existing Twilio account status
- [ ] Understand message volume limitations
- [ ] Check regulatory paperwork requirements
- [ ] Document any compliance steps needed for scale

## Technical Notes

**From today's meeting:**

* R Odili: "In my previous company that did Twilio with SMS, there was this big regulatory paper we had to fill out... I think that's going to take about a week"
* Shaw: "We did do this for the Trump thing and we got that set up"
* Question is can we send 50 or 50,000 messages?
* If limited to 50, need to talk to Twilio
* Shaw will escalate if Twilio breaks down
* Neo might know about the Trump project account
* Note: This is different from main Twilio that Ren has access to

## Priority

**P1 - Research in parallel, don't block development**

topIssues.title: [Infra] Fix MCP Plugin 3-Second Initialization Delay
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Investigate and resolve the 3-second MCP plugin initialization delay on Vercel due to WebSocket handshake requirements.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Understand root cause of 3-second delay
- [ ] Research options: Redis cache, Gateway pattern, or dedicated server
- [ ] Implement solution that keeps connection alive
- [ ] Test performance improvement

## Technical Notes

**From today's meeting (Ben):**

* MCP plugin takes 3 seconds to initialize on every message
* Caused by needing to establish WebSocket communication with server
* Vercel serverless functions don't maintain state between invocations
* Options discussed:
  1. Redis cache for connection state (but WebSocket still needs reconnect)
  2. Gateway pattern like Discord (dedicated server for stateful connections)
  3. Accept the delay for now, optimize later

**Shaw's guidance:**

* For any WebSocket service, use the Gateway pattern similar to Discord
* "It's not like everything has to be serverless" - just avoid idle pods doing nothing
* Gateway service can scale, handles WebSocket → turns into HTTP to agent

## Assignee

Ben

## Priority

**P1 - Important but not blocking MVP**

topIssues.title: [Infra] Messaging Connection UI & Routing Service
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Sam's work on messaging infrastructure including UI settings card, webhook endpoints, database tables, and routing service.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Messaging connection UI in dashboard
- [ ] Settings card for connecting Google/Twilio/SMS/Blue iMessage
- [ ] Service that routes incoming SMS/iMessages to correct agent
- [ ] Automatic response sending
- [ ] Endpoints for Twilio and [Blue.io](<http://Blue.io>) webhooks
- [ ] Database tables for messaging connections
- [ ] E2E tests

## Technical Notes

**From today's meeting (Sam):**

* Already built MVP of messaging connection UI
* Settings card for connecting accounts from dashboard
* Service routes incoming messages to right AI agent, sends back response automatically
* Created endpoints for Twilio and [Blue.io](<http://Blue.io>) webhooks
* Created database tables
* Wrote E2E tests
* Still testing UI, will share video when ready
* PR coming soon - prioritize review

## Assignee

Sam

## Status

**In Progress - PR coming soon**

topPRs.title: Create SECURITY.md
topPRs.author: j4lambert
topPRs.body:
# Relates to # Risks # Background ## What does this PR do? ## What kind of change is this? # Documentation changes needed? # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? ## Detailed testing steps

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

Added a SECURITY.md file using GitHub's default template, but the content was not customized for the ElizaOS project. - The "Supported Versions" table lists incorrect version numbers (5.1.x, 5.0.x, 4.0.x) that don't match ElizaOS's actual versioning scheme (currently at v1.7.x) - The "Reporting a Vulnerability" section contains only placeholder text instructing authors to fill in the content, with no actual reporting instructions - The file should be updated with ElizaOS-specific information: accurate version numbers, actual vulnerability reporting channels (GitHub Security Advisories, Discord), and expected response timelines

Confidence Score: 1/5

- This PR should not be merged without completing the SECURITY.md content with project-specific information - Score reflects that while adding a SECURITY.md file is good practice, this PR only adds GitHub's unmodified template with placeholder text and incorrect version numbers. The file provides no actual value to users trying to report vulnerabilities or understand which versions receive security updates. - SECURITY.md requires complete rewrite with actual ElizaOS project information

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | SECURITY.md | Added GitHub's default SECURITY.md template without customization - contains placeholder text and incorrect version numbers (5.1.x instead of 1.7.x) |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User as Security Researcher participant GH as GitHub Repository participant SECURITY as SECURITY.md File participant Team as ElizaOS Team User->>GH: Visit repository User->>SECURITY: Read SECURITY.md Note over SECURITY: Currently shows
placeholder template
with wrong versions SECURITY-->>User: Template text:
"Use this section to..." User->>User: Confused about
how to report Note over User,Team: Expected Flow (after fix): User->>SECURITY: Read SECURITY.md SECURITY-->>User: Clear instructions:
1.7.x supported
Use GitHub Security
Advisories or Discord User->>Team: Reports vulnerability
via proper channel Team->>User: Response within 48h ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
